Name: DOC
Definition: Denominazione di Origine Controllata – an Italian wine classification that guarantees the wine’s origin and adherence to specific production regulations.

Name: DOCG
Definition: Denominazione di Origine Controllata e Garantita – Italy’s highest classification for wines, ensuring stricter quality controls and tasting evaluations.

Name: Piemonte
Definition: A renowned wine-producing region in northwest Italy, known for Barolo, Barbaresco, and other high-quality wines made from Nebbiolo, Barbera, and Dolcetto.

Name: Body
Definition: Describes the weight and fullness of the wine in your mouth. Light-bodied wines feel more like water; full-bodied wines feel more like milk or cream.

Name: Tannins
Definition: Naturally occurring compounds found in grape skins, seeds, and stems that give red wines their astringency, structure, and aging potential.
